metadata.title: Human Phenotype & Loop Database
metadata.description: A structured taxonomy of human behavioral loops, social signals, and cognitive glitches.

categories.name: Digital & Cognitive Loops
categories.description: Modern technology and cognition-related behavioral feedback loops

logic.then: Thigh muscles twitch, simulating a buzz that didn't happen
logic.result: Subject checks a blank screen, reinforcing the dopamine loop

operator.name: The Ghost Signal
operator.mechanism: Neural pathways anticipating reward create sensory hallucinations.

intervention.interdict: Use app limits, grayscale, or notification management
intervention.minimize: Seek feedback from trusted allies about perception gaps
intervention.recognize: Be aware of physical comfort/discomfort in interactions

loops.name: The Now vs. Not Now Loop

logic.when: Told an event is in 3 weeks
logic.then: The event does not exist until T-minus 1 hour
logic.result: Calm demeanor followed by explosive, manic productivity

operator.name: The Panic Horizon
operator.mechanism: Dopamine deficiency requires extreme urgency to trigger executive function.

intervention.interdict: Use implementation intentions: "When X happens, I will do Y"
intervention.minimize: Reframe the situation: what would an objective observer see?
intervention.recognize: Notice when internal narratives affect external behavior

logic.then: Subject panics, believing they have 'tricked' everyone
logic.result: Over-preparation and eventual burnout

operator.name: The Con Artist Operator
operator.mechanism: Success is re-contextualized as deception rather than merit.

intervention.interdict: Actively construct and share an alternative narrative
intervention.minimize: Set hard boundaries; this loop will consume all available energy if unchecked.
intervention.recognize: Notice when internal narratives affect external behavior

logic.given: Forced proximity in a metal box
logic.then: Everyone fixates on the floor numbers
logic.result: Suppression of all human interaction until the ding

operator.name: The Collective Trance
operator.mechanism: Temporary suspension of social contract to manage territorial stress.

intervention.interdict: Change or modify the triggering environment
intervention.minimize: Prepare counter-narratives in advance for recurring situations
intervention.recognize: Notice spatial behaviors in group dynamics

logic.when: Warning the group of a future disaster
logic.then: The group laughs or ignores the warning
logic.result: The disaster happens, and the group blames the subject for 'jinxing' it

operator.name: The Curse
operator.mechanism: Cognitive dissonance causes group to shoot the messenger rather than accept bad news.

intervention.interdict: Build relationships that reinforce the desired identity
intervention.minimize: Prepare counter-narratives in advance for recurring situations
intervention.recognize: Notice when you're reacting to HOW something is said vs WHAT

logic.given: Total lack of expectation or fear of failure
logic.when: Attempting a complex task (e.g., pool shot)
logic.then: Muscle tension is absent, allowing perfect fluidity
logic.result: Success that vanishes the moment the subject 'tries'

operator.name: The Flow State
operator.mechanism: Absence of pre-frontal cortex interference in motor tasks.

intervention.interdict: Practice deliberate counter-behaviors in low-stakes situations
intervention.minimize: Recognize the loop is triggering and pause before reacting
intervention.leverage: Amplify in social or romantic contexts
intervention.recognize: Pay attention to body language shifts

logic.given: Learning a new word or concept
logic.when: Navigating the world the next day
logic.then: It appears everywhere
logic.result: The feeling that the simulation just 'patched' the data in

operator.name: The Rendering Engine
operator.mechanism: Selective attention filter is updated, allowing previously ignored data to pass.

intervention.interdict: Set intentional friction for problematic tech behaviors
intervention.minimize: Use grounding techniques to avoid emotional hijacking
intervention.recognize: Notice when internal narratives affect external behavior

logic.then: The Ego is born
logic.result: The beginning of anxiety, vanity, and the social self

operator.name: The User
operator.mechanism: The 'Mirror Stage' of development where subjectivity separates from the environment.

intervention.leverage: Pair with competence demonstrations for maximum effect
intervention.recognize: Watch for recursive self-doubt or self-fulfilling prophecies
intervention.minimize: Ground yourself with deep breathing; this is a perceptual distortion, not reality.

categories.name: Dental & Oral Signals

logic.given: an individual possesses Class I Occlusion (Perfectly straight/white teeth)
logic.when: they smile during a first impression or job interview
logic.then: the observer unconsciously registers "High Socioeconomic Status" and "Self-Discipline" (The Halo Operator)
logic.result: higher rates of hiring and the development of **Social Ease** (expectation of acceptance)

operator.name: The Halo Operator
operator.mechanism: the observer unconsciously registers "High Socioeconomic Status" and "Self-Discipline"

intervention.interdict: Reframe the narrative around this characteristic
intervention.minimize: Reframe the situation: what would an objective observer see?

logic.given: an individual possesses Visible Malocclusion or Discoloration
logic.then: they engage in "guarding behaviors" (covering mouth with hand)
logic.result: the perception of **Dishonesty** or **Shyness** by others (The Deception Operator), reinforcing **Social Withdrawal**

operator.name: Unknown Operator
operator.mechanism: they engage in "guarding behaviors" (covering mouth with hand)

intervention.interdict: Proactively seek social exposure in safe, low-stakes environments to break the cycle.
intervention.minimize: Prepare counter-narratives in advance for recurring situations

categories.name: Neuroscience Mechanisms
categories.description: Fundamental neurobiological and behavioral mechanisms underlying human behavior

logic.given: User initiates an action with an uncertain outcome (e.g., pulling a lever, refreshing a feed)
logic.when: The system provides a reward only intermittently and unpredictably
logic.then: Dopamine spikes higher during anticipation than receipt phase
logic.result: Subject increases frequency of action to resolve uncertainty; compulsive behavior

operator.name: The Dopamine Prediction Error
operator.mechanism: Variable ratio schedules exploit the mesolimbic pathway - because reward is not guaranteed, dopamine fires maximally during anticipation, not receipt.

intervention.interdict: Remove variable reinforcement by making outcomes predictable or adding friction
intervention.minimize: Set hard limits on engagement time before starting
intervention.recognize: Notice the urge to 'just check one more time'

logic.given: Subject invests significant resources (time, money, effort) into a decision path
logic.when: External data indicates the decision is failing or yields negative utility
logic.then: Accepting failure requires admitting waste of past resources (psychological pain)
logic.result: Subject doubles down to justify previous expenditures; compounding losses

operator.name: The Sunk Cost Fallacy Engine
operator.mechanism: Loss aversion (k  2.25 in Prospect Theory) makes the pain of 'waste' outweigh rational future-oriented analysis.

intervention.interdict: Pre-commit to 'kill criteria' before investing
intervention.minimize: Ask: 'Would I start this project today knowing what I know now?'
intervention.recognize: Notice defensiveness when presented with negative data

logic.given: Subject is exposed to aversive stimuli (pain, failure, rejection)
logic.when: Feedback indicates that Outcome is independent of Behavior (non-contingency)
logic.then: vmPFC determines 'No Control' and stops inhibiting the Brainstem (DRN)
logic.result: Passivity and cessation of all attempts to change, even when escape becomes possible

operator.name: The Controllability Switch
operator.mechanism: Dorsal Raphe Nucleus (5-HT) becomes uninhibited when vmPFC detects non-contingency between action and outcome.

intervention.interdict: Create forced success experiences to reactivate vmPFC control circuits
intervention.minimize: Start with extremely small, achievable actions to rebuild agency
intervention.recognize: Notice thoughts like 'nothing I do matters' or 'why bother'

logic.given: Sensory trigger activates a stored pattern (e.g., walking into a dark room)
logic.when: The brain executes a stored behavioral script (reaching for light switch)
logic.then: Prefrontal Cortex activity drops significantly to save energy
logic.result: Automatic execution even when context changes; dopamine fires at Cue, not Reward

operator.name: The Basal Ganglia Shortcut
operator.mechanism: Dopamine shifts from Reward-Phase to Cue-Phase (VTA  Striatum), creating craving at the sight of the trigger.

intervention.interdict: Disrupt the cue-routine-reward loop by changing the environment
intervention.minimize: Insert a pause between cue and routine to engage prefrontal cortex
intervention.recognize: Notice actions you perform without conscious decision

logic.given: Subject chooses between Small Reward (Now) vs Large Reward (Later)
logic.when: The time delay is salient in the decision
logic.then: Hyperbolic discounting causes future value to crash near zero (V = A / (1 + kD))
logic.result: Chronic failure to execute long-term goals despite rational intentions

operator.name: The Present Bias Calculator
operator.mechanism: Future self is processed neurologically as a 'stranger' (low dlPFC activity), reducing resource sharing with one's own future.

intervention.interdict: Use pre-commitment devices (lock money away, schedule in advance)
intervention.minimize: Visualize your future self vividly to increase empathy for them
intervention.recognize: Notice when you hear yourself say 'I'll start tomorrow'

logic.given: Sensory input detects a crude threat marker (loud bang, snake-like shape)
logic.when: Signal goes directly to Amygdala via Thalamus (~12ms fast path)
logic.then: HPA axis triggers before Cortex can provide context (~30-40ms slow path)
logic.result: Subject reacts emotionally/physically to stimulus before conscious identification

operator.name: The Low Road Trigger
operator.mechanism: Thalamo-Amygdala pathway bypasses cortical processing; the cortex goes offline due to neurochemical flooding.

intervention.interdict: Avoid known triggers when possible; create environmental safety
intervention.minimize: Use 6-second breathing to engage vagal brake before responding
intervention.recognize: Notice physical symptoms (heart rate, muscle tension) before emotion label

logic.given: Chronic psychological or physical threat activates the HPA axis
logic.when: Cortisol release causes downregulation of Glucocorticoid Receptors in Hippocampus
logic.then: The 'brakes' are cut - brain can no longer sense cortisol levels
logic.result: Runaway stress response, hippocampal atrophy, and metabolic syndrome

operator.name: The Feedback Failure
operator.mechanism: Glucocorticoid Cascade Hypothesis: chronic cortisol causes receptor downregulation, breaking negative feedback.

intervention.interdict: Remove chronic stressors; prioritize sleep and recovery
intervention.minimize: Implement daily stress-reduction practices (meditation, exercise)
intervention.recognize: Notice flattened diurnal rhythm (tired in morning, wired at night)

logic.given: Environmental signal (e.g., low maternal care, high stress in early life)
logic.when: DNA Methyltransferase enzymes attach methyl groups to gene promoter regions
logic.then: Transcription factors are physically blocked from reading stress receptor genes
logic.result: Gene is silenced; subject produces fewer stress receptors permanently

operator.name: The Methylation Lock
operator.mechanism: Promoter methylation (CpG islands) causes steric hindrance, silencing NR3C1 gene and creating high-anxiety phenotype.

intervention.interdict: Requires Histone Deacetylase Inhibitors or intense behavioral intervention
intervention.minimize: Focus on environmental enrichment and secure attachment relationships
intervention.recognize: Notice family patterns of anxiety/stress reactivity across generations

logic.given: Subject A provides benefit to Subject B (Cost to A < Benefit to B)
logic.then: Cheater Detection Module (specialized cognitive circuit) activates
logic.result: Subject A enacts punishment (aggression/exclusion) to prevent freeloaders

operator.name: The Reciprocity Enforcer
operator.mechanism: Specialized cognitive module evolved for detecting violations of social contracts in reciprocal altruism.

intervention.interdict: Verify information before acting on cheater detection signals
intervention.minimize: Practice Tit-for-Tat with forgiveness - one act of restitution clears debts
intervention.recognize: Notice moral outrage disproportionate to the actual violation

logic.given: Brain generates top-down probabilistic model of what is happening
logic.when: Sensory input differs from prediction, creating prediction error
logic.then: Brain must either update model OR act on world to match prediction
logic.result: Perception is successful suppression of prediction error; failures cause distortion

operator.name: The Free Energy Minimizer
operator.mechanism: Predictive processing / Bayesian inference: top-down predictions compete with bottom-up sensory error signals.

intervention.interdict: Seek novel experiences that force model updating
intervention.minimize: Practice precision weighting - ask 'how confident am I in this perception?'
intervention.recognize: Notice when you see what you expect rather than what is there
